title: Intensity Modulated Radiation Therapy
summary: IMRT uses computer-controlled linear accelerators to deliver precise radiation beams that conform to complex tumor shapes while sparing surrounding normal tissue through inverse treatment planning optimization.

content.text: IMRT delivers non-uniform fluence across treatment fields using multileaf collimators (MLCs) that dynamically shape the beam during delivery. Inverse planning algorithms optimize beam intensities to meet dose-volume constraints.

IMRT can be delivered using step-and-shoot (segmental MLC), dynamic MLC (sliding window), or volumetric modulated arc therapy (VMAT) techniques, each with specific advantages and quality assurance requirements.
IMRT is particularly beneficial for tumors near critical organs such as head and neck cancers, prostate cancer, and brain tumors where dose escalation and normal tissue sparing are crucial.
IMRT requires comprehensive QA including dose verification, MLC positional accuracy, and patient-specific plan verification before treatment delivery.
